unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Which Distribution for Two Population Proportions?
question_text: When completing a significance test for the difference between two population proportions, which of the following distributions should be used?

choices.text: A binomial distribution where n n is the combined number of observations from both populations and p p is the overall proportion of successful observations.
A z z -distribution that assumes a mean difference of 0 0 .
A t t -distribution that assumes a mean difference of 0 0 .
A χ 2 χ 2 distribution where d f = n − 1 d f = n − 1 and n n is the combined number of observations from both populations.
